fields.description: It would be nice to be able to define different default dashboards for different types of users. For example, someone working in client services would probably be interested in a different dashboard view than a developer. Obviously everyone can create their own custom configuration but it would save a lot of time if we had a list of defaults to choose from.
fields.summary: Multiple default dashboards

fields.description:
We want to be able to set custom fields when resolving or reopening an issue without having to go to edit issue afterwards.  Is it possible to add the ability to show custom fields on those screens??

Thanks!
fields.summary: add ability to add a custom field to resolve issue & reopen issue screens

fields.description:
The <embed> tag for putting the screenshot applet into it's page appears to have a hardcoded assumption that jira will be installed as the root web-app context. i.e.

<EMBED
    type =" application/x-java-applet;version=1.3.1"
    CODE =" com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreenshotApplet" ARCHIVE =" /secure/applet/screenshot.jar"

If I have jira installed at, say, http://myhost.com/jira/ ,  and I've set up the base URL in my system config, then the ARCHIVE parameter should respect this. As it is the applet can't find it's classes. so it doesn't work. I think it should be something like

<EMBED
    type ="application/x-java-applet;version=1.3.1"
    CODE ="com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreenshotApplet" ARCHIVE ="http://myhost.com/jira/secure/applet/screenshot.jar"
fields.summary: archive path for screenshot applet does not pick up base URL config setting

fields.description:
All of our employees are allowed (or even encouraged ;-) to report bugs. However only people in the tech department may edit the issues.

We want the initial information to be as easy to enter as possible and therefore we want the Issue Fields to be very few (Summary, Type, Priority, Description).

The issues are then reviewed and assigned by the project lead. At this point being able to fill in more information, such as due date, original time estimate etc is useful.

In order to make this work better it would be nice if the Issue Field configuration could be made separate for "Create Issue" and "Edit Issue"
fields.summary: Separate configuration of Issue Fields for create and edit issue

Created/Updated times are shown in server time zone, not the client's one

fields.description:
1. Go to the login page
2. Click "Forgot password"
3. Enter an existing username in uppercase
4. Click "Send it to me"

A username is normally in lowercase, but by entering the username in uppercase and saying that you have forgot the password a new password is generated like normally and send to the users email, but one other crucial thing also happens: The username is now also changed to uppercase.

When the unaware user gets the e-mail and try to login with the new auto generated password the user is told that "Sorry, your username and password are incorrect - please try again.". This is because he is now trying to login with a lowercase username. If the user is smart he will see that the mail with the new password also lists his username and that this is in uppercase. If he then tries to login with his username in uppercase and the new password, he is shown this message: "You do not have the permissions required to browse any projects." (Just like in the JRA-2349 issue).

The only solution for the user now is to do like the hacker and request a new password (just this time by writing his username in lowercase). Now his username is changed back to lowercase. When he now tries to login with his new password and his lowercase username it works fine.

An interesting side effect is that now it is not possible to login with an uppercase username anymore like in JRA-2349. It is still possible though to change the username back to uppercase again with the method described above.

BTW: This bug is close related to JRA-2349. JRA-2349 is in tern close related to JRA-2905 which is a duplicate. The two bugs JRA-2157 and JRA-2148 has maybe also some relevance - but not as much as JRA-2349 and is duplicate JRA-2905.
fields.summary: Everybody can change another users username so the user can't login

fields.description:
While CVS is the most widely used Version Control System in the open source community (and other communities), it has many glitches.

Subversion (http://subversion.tigris.org/) is a compelling replacement for CVS. Our company is looking into transitioning into it.

It should also be more friendly to JIRA, since log messages are stored per commit (and not per commit x every file); so an email-comment system like the current CVS mails would work much better (a single comment instead of tens of them); also the CVS integration in 2.6 would be much lighter due to the decreased log size (see issue JRA-3183)

Since Subversion interface has been kept close to CVS, my guess it's that shouldn't be too hard to implement suppport for it based on the current support for CVS.
fields.summary: Support for Subversion (VCS)

fields.description:
a new request (i.e. resetting all criteria) often deals with same project than previous request.
a "new same project" could be helpful (since getting project-specific stuff is a step that could be avoided in this case)
fields.summary: new request on same project

fields.description:
When I enter Russian word as a pattern to QUICK SEARCH, JIRA shows filter edit screen with error diagnostics "Invalid start character '?'".

If I put the same pattern to a "Query" field of this screen I'm getting the search results as expected.

If I use search pattern in English, everything goes OK.

Pity that such convenient feature can't be used in most of my cases :-).
fields.summary: Problem with national character in QUICK SEARCH

fields.description: JIRA allows you to assign permissions on who can create projects. In the default permission scheme, I added the "jira-developers" group to the "Administer Projects" permission. While this then shows the ability to add a project to developers, if you actually select the add project link, JIRA will prompt the user to login. It will continue prompting the user to login until you signon using a username belonging to the "jira-administrator" group.
fields.summary: Implement an Add Project Permission

fields.description:
When a user has "found" a list of issues, and chooses to download to Excel, every custom field is given a column, regardless of whether the field is used in the given list of issues or not.

We have over 700 custom fields (really).  Excel can't deal with all those columns.  Besides, a user does not want to or need to see all those columns.

Really, what our users want most often is an exact copy of what's on screen, only in Excel - they don't want all the columns they can't see.  Also, if they've changed the navigator layout, they want that to appear in Excel.

What Jira seems to be offering by this link is a way to get the entire issue into Excel - more like "download full content to Excel".  I can see that might be useful - but the other case is more useful.  Perhaps you need two links - just like you have "Browser" and "Full Content" view - only for Excel.

At any rate, it is absolutely necessary that some screening of the columns is done.
fields.summary: Export to excel does not retain issue navigator columns

fields.description:
When JIRA breaks for some reason, and users see output of 500page.jsp, the JIRA admin typically wants to know about this.  JIRA ought to log (to a special log4j category) all the info displayed on the screen.

A nice way to do with is create a bean containing all diagnostic info, whose toString() prints a nicely formatted log. The bean could be instantiated in the JSP with <webwork:bean> and rendered.
fields.summary: 500 errors should be logged

fields.description:
When sending a Support Request from the administration menu in JIRA today the e-mail subject is:
[???] JIRA Automated Support Request
(where ??? is replaced with whatever the administrator has defined as the default email prefix).

It would be very usefull if there was appended som sort of incrementing tracking number to the end of the subject like this:
[???] JIRA Automated Support Request #21

This way the administrator could always see what reply from Atlassian relates to what request.

And this is not just hypothetically. The reason why I report this issue is because I just send two different support requests and now its actually very hard for me to keep them separated.
fields.summary: Tracking number on Support Requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3286].
  {panel}

The feature "timetracking", which activated the 'developer workload report' is already a nice feature for basic logging of work.

The estimation of work could be used for project management to check estimated workload of developer, re-assign tasks/improvements for future versions to reduce over-all time needed to finish a future version etc.
Currently it's very difficult to check the man-power resources and there workload.

I'd like to suggest some enhancements to make this more usable for the project management:

1. Allow ProjectManager to check estimated Workload of all developer

Developers sometimes work for more than one project simultaneously.
The developer workload report already takes this into account by reporting the workload of the developer over all projects.  From the point of a developer, the "workload report" is fine, but from the point of a project manager it's difficult because she needs to generate the report for every developer.
Would be much easier when report is created for all project and for all developer.  This could be a bit tricky with permissions, well, right.  But for project manager it would be perfect to get a table like this (JRA and OTHER are projects):

Developer       Workload-JRA  Workload-OTHER
--------------------------------------------
Martin Skopp              8h        1w 2d 3h
Scott Farquhar          120h             20h
Owen Fellows             48h             35h

See also JRA-3111 for another idea how to improve the report.


2. Adding "Versions" for Workload report
Addtionally to 1., I would appreciate to get a Workload for single project over all developers and versions, e.g.

Workload report for Project JIRA (JRA):
Developer              2.6.1             2.7
--------------------------------------------
Martin Skopp              8h        1w 2d 3h (x)
Scott Farquhar          120h (y)         20h
Owen Fellows            4,5d (z)         35h

Optionally, it would be nice to allow the user to select the unit for the work, e.g. standard, like (x) or in hours (y) or in days (z).


3. Add date/time field to Log Work on issues 
Sometimes, I forget to log my work on a issue and want to log my work the next day.  No problem, this is possible, but the date of the worklog entry is created by JIRA.  I would appreciate that the reporter can soecify a start date of the worklog.  This would allow the forgetful developers like me to create more accurate worklog entries.


4. The worklog entries could be used by project management to monitor progress within a new version.
The problem is that there are no reports available for project management to check which work has been done e.g. during the last week or days.  Yeah, one can filter all issues which changed within the last days, but a real "worklog report" or filtering on worklog entries would be very nice.
E.g.:
Filter properties: 
Project = JRA
Version = 2.6.1
Worklogs = -1w to 0 (=relative date one week ago up to today)

Result: all worklog entries (not the issues!) which match.


5. Worklog entries do not appear in filter results!  This makes it really difficult for project management to monitor work logs (well it's possible via notification, right).
So it would be great if optionally display of worklog entries could be enabled in a filter result somehow.
Maybe this is obsoleted by 4. already...


So that's it!  The basic feature request is "make it more easy for project manager to check estimated workload and development success".
For any more questions etc. please do not hesitate to contact me.
Thanks for reading this long issue.

P.S.: I really love JIRA, really.

Martin Skopp
skopp@riege.com
fields.summary: Extends TimeTracking to comprehensive work+project reports for Projectmanagement

fields.description:
The administration page now knows collapsable sections, which make it easier to find the correct section.

The filter definition page doesn't know the collapse functionality, while searches with both date/time, text and attribute are not very common.

I prefer this functionality also in the filters menu, opening only the sections which are used when editing a filter; opening no sections when a new filter is started (beside the special section for choosing the project).

See JRA-3088.
fields.summary: Collapsable sections in filter

fields.description:
Currently, the hide/show/required/ordering of issue fields in the "View Issue Fields" is for all issue types. 

This configuration should be by issue type, so that one can hide fields which are not important for some issue types, and show the field on other issue types.
fields.summary: Field Layout Schemes should be by Issue Type

fields.description:
We created a fresh install of 2.6 for testing purposes, primarily hoping it would clear up our problems with there being a blank status field when first creating an issue. 

We took the following steps: 

1. Created a project. 
2. Added an issue of type bug - the issue status is blank 
3. Changed the status of this issue (manually) to 1 in DB
4. Added new issue - also blank 
5. Ran DB checker - it resets both status to blank
5. Ran DB checker again - produces error
(see attached screens) 

One thing I did notice (after we created a second project) is we can create an issue no-fail with a status if we only fill out the Summary field.  If we type in other fields (e.g. environment), the status is blank.

fields.description: When changing the name of a project it is not possible to change only the capitalization. Eg: "My project" cannot be renamed to "My Project" without the error: "A project with that name already exists". I first have to rename it to "My Project Temp" and then to "My Project".

fields.description:
We are using our own language.jar file in french. If we use the ' character in a string where a link is present, this link is not generated.
For example : 
issue.operations.voting.notvoted = Vous n'avez pas voté pour cette demande. {0}Voter pour elle{1}.

This string is displayed like that : Vous n avez pas voté pour cette demande. {0}Voter pour elle{1}.

The ' character is not understood, and the link between {0} and {1} is not transform into an anchor HTML tag.
If a replace the ' character by a space, it works.

fields.description: In the "Return to search" box when viewing an issue there is a Previous and Next link when the user is within a search. If the user either votes or watches an issue while being within a search the Previous and Next link disappears (only the "Return to search" link remains).

http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/2.6/com/atlassian/jira/issue/customfields/CustomFieldUtils.html

C:\apps\atlassian-jira-professional-2.6-standalone-tomcat\work\Standalone\localhost\_\import_csv_jsp.java:283: createUpdateCustomFieldValues(org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue,java.util.Map,java.util.Locale) in com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.CustomFieldUtils cannot be applied to (org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericValue,java.util.Map)      CustomFieldUtils.createUpdateCustomFieldValues( issue, customFieldValues);

fields.description: When opening or closing the groups in the administration menu on the left side of the screen, the last operation is done once again. fields.description:

It should be possible to select a checkbox saying that you which to send the e-mail using the "Bcc:" header instead.

This is very important because we have many different costumers.

/watson

fields.description:

"/usr/local/tomcat/logs/catalina_log.2004-03-01.txt "
I get an error saying that the file does not exist. If I instead write:
"/usr/local/tomcat/logs/catalina_log.2004-03-01.txt"

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3269].
  {panel}

One of our managers would like to set up a filter to e-mail everybody with their unresolved issues on a weekly basis.  I thought they'd be able to do with a shared filter on 'Current user' to which they then subscribe their group.  However, the users got e-mails with the manager's unresolved issues!

Is it possible for a manager to set up such a filter for their group, or does each member have to subscribe themselves?

Cheers,

  Mike

fields.description:
I have been having a couple of problems with the "Browse project" screens, which can be replicated thus:

1. Start from a completely fresh browser, not logged in
2. Navigate to http://jira.atlassian.com/browse
3. You get a list of available projects - click on 'Jira'
4. Witness erroneous "You don't have permissions to view this page" screen
5. Click 'Log in' link at top right of page
6. Witness implausible 'This project does not exist' screen

This may happen if you click a link to a project or issue without being logged in.  It can be resolved by navigating to the home page and going in through the 'usual channels'.

Cheers,

fields.description:
This is something I really miss from PVCS Tracker (now Merant Tracker). In addition to change notification emails, they had in their client app an "inbox" that was a list of all the subscribed bugs that had changed. After reviewing one, you could delete it from the inbox, and it would only show up again if it changed again.

The difference between this and an email notify or RSS solution is that Tracker would not create a new entry when a bug that was already in the inbox had changed - it would update the existing one.

The issue I'm trying to address here is when I review bug change notifications in my email inbox. I will frequently see five changes to the same bug - a comment, another comment, someone started work on it, then assigned it, etc. So I can't see the list of all changes at once for a particular issue.

Feature request: provide a "bug inbox" like I've described above that runs via the JIRA web interface. This would be very useful to anyone reviewing bugs.
fields.summary: Inbox feature for reviewing bugs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. go to jira.atlassian.com (don't login!)
2. browse any issue
3. the 'If you were logged in you would be able to see more operations.' link points to http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fbrowse

This breaks ease-of-usage of JIRA and should be fixed before 2.6 final IMO.

fields.description:
somewhere it should be noted that creating a new user group in order to find issues (Find Issues -> Assignee: Specific Group) requires reindexing before the search will work.

probably this doesn't work in the expected way: currently, the groups are stored in the issue index and issues are returned based on whether the group name is found in the index.  this means that if I add a user to a group, all the issues need to be reindexed.  it seems like it would be better to pull a list of all the users in the group at search time, and find issues associated with any of these users.
fields.summary: creating a new user group requires reindex

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3219].
  {panel}

Currently, setting a filter with two columns sorted in the right way is not easy to acomplish.

I want an extra screen on which you can specify the following for viewing issues and building filters:

First Sort Column  - Accend/Decend*
Second Sort Column - Accend/Decend
Third Sort Column  - Accend/Decend
Fourth Sort Column - Accend/Decend

where:

Accend = 'lowest' first
Decend = 'higest' first (Blocker, Bug, Open, newest date, unresolved, newest release)
fields.summary: Specify sorting on filters

fields.description:
We should add this feature to atlassian trackback (I think that it is also a Confluence feature request).

This is so that you may wish to only ping URLs in your local network, and not on the internet.
fields.summary: Trackbacks should have regexps for which hosts to accept & ping

fields.description:
It would be great if Jira permission scheme included, in the permission acceptors list, additional entities, besides the simple list of available groups. Entities like:
1) Current Assignee
2) Current Reporter
3) Project Lead

would help.

It would also make JIRA more powerful if a group could be set up so that  it would be allowed users to join that group automatically. I can see a useful use-case of such feature: 

Let's say I have a project Foo and I set up a group Foo Watchers that will be in the notifications scheme for project Foo, receiving alerts from changes in Foo. Anybody who wants to watch the project Foo as a whole will join this group on their own (without the necessity of Project Admin's involvement) and begin watching all issues in that project rather than having to manually turn on watching for each issue.


thank you
fields.summary: More granularity in Permissioning would be nice.

fields.description:
I realize that this information is currently available through the issue's 'Change History' tab, but I feel it would improve the interface to also include the username and date in the 'Attachments' section of the issue view.  
  
Take for example, http://jira.opensymphony.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=SIM-74&page=comments
 
Whose "PageResponseWrapper.java (9 kb)" is whose? And when was it uploaded?  I have to switch to the 'Change History' tab to see this information.  But then, that doesn't even help me distinguish between the two files of the same name.   (they are numbered in the attachment view, but not in the change history).
 
As an alternate to listing the name/date  in the 'Attachments' section at top, would you consider making the attachements in the 'Change History' tab links ?  (Esentially, duplicate the link from the 'Attachments' section). That way I know exactly which one I'm downloading.
fields.summary: List of attachments -  include name and date
